intro: Pseudosagotia brevipetiolata, commonly known as the short-petioled pseudosagotia, is a member of the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its small, trifoliate leaves with short petioles, and its flowers are typically arranged in racemes. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
